Typealiases.html#/LocationDirection.name: LocationDirection
Typealiases.html#/LocationDirection.abstract: An azimuth measured in degrees clockwise from true north.

Typealiases.html#/JSONObject.name: JSONObject
Typealiases.html#/JSONObject.abstract: A JSON object represented in memory by a dictionary with strings as keys and JSONValue instances as values.

Typealiases.html#/LocationRadians.name: LocationRadians
Typealiases.html#/LocationRadians.abstract: A latitude or longitude measured in radians, as opposed to LocationDegrees, which is measured in degrees of arc.

Typealiases.html#/RadianDistance.name: RadianDistance
Typealiases.html#/RadianDistance.abstract: A difference in latitude or longitude measured in radians, as opposed to CLLocationDegrees, which is used by some libraries to represent a similar distance measured in degrees of arc.

Typealiases.html#/LineSegment.name: LineSegment
Typealiases.html#/LineSegment.abstract: A segment between two positions in a LineString geometry or Ring.

Structs/Ring.html#/coordinates.name: coordinates
Structs/Ring.html#/coordinates.abstract: The positions at which the linear ring is located.

Structs/Ring.html#/init(coordinates:).name: init(coordinates:)
Structs/Ring.html#/init(coordinates:).abstract: Initializes a linear ring defined by the given positions.

Structs/Ring.html#/area.name: area
Structs/Ring.html#/area.abstract: Calculate the approximate area of the polygon were it projected onto the earth, in square meters.

Structs/Ring.html#/contains(_:ignoreBoun.name: contains(_:ignoreBoundary:)
Structs/Ring.html#/contains(_:ignoreBoun.abstract: Determines if the given point falls within the ring.

Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html#/init(la.name: init(latitude:longitude:)
Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html#/init(la.abstract: Initializes a coordinate pair located at the given latitude and longitude.

Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html#/init(_:.name: init(_:)
Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html#/init(_:.abstract: Initializes a coordinate pair measured in radians that is coincident to the given coordinate pair measured in degrees of arc.

Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html#/coordin.name: coordinate(at:facing:)
Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html#/coordin.abstract: Returns coordinate at a given distance and direction away from coordinate.

Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html#/distanc.name: distance(to:)
Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html#/distanc.abstract: Returns the Haversine distance between two coordinates measured in radians.

Structs/Polygon.html#/coordinates.name: coordinates
Structs/Polygon.html#/coordinates.abstract: The positions at which the polygon is located. Each nested array corresponds to one linear ring.

Structs/Polygon.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Structs/Polygon.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a polygon defined by the given positions.

Structs/Polygon.html#/init(outerRing:inn.name: init(outerRing:innerRings:)
Structs/Polygon.html#/init(outerRing:inn.abstract: Initializes a polygon defined by the given linear rings.

Structs/Polygon.html#/init(center:radius.name: init(center:radius:vertices:)
Structs/Polygon.html#/init(center:radius.abstract: Initializes a polygon as a given center coordinate with a given number of

Structs/Polygon.html#/contains(_:ignoreB.name: contains(_:ignoreBoundary:)
Structs/Polygon.html#/contains(_:ignoreB.abstract: Returns whether the given coordinate falls within the polygon and outside of its interior rings.

Structs/Polygon.html#/smooth(iterations:.name: smooth(iterations:)
Structs/Polygon.html#/smooth(iterations:.abstract: Returns the polygon with corners smoothed out using Chaikin’s algorithm.

Structs/Polygon.html#/simplified(toleran.name: simplified(tolerance:highestQuality:)
Structs/Polygon.html#/simplified(toleran.abstract: Returns a copy of the polygon simplified using the Ramer–Douglas–Peucker algorithm.

Structs/Polygon.html#/simplify(tolerance.name: simplify(tolerance:highestQuality:)
Structs/Polygon.html#/simplify(tolerance.abstract: Simplifies the polygon in place using the Ramer–Douglas–Peucker algorithm.

Structs/Polygon.html#/center.name: center
Structs/Polygon.html#/center.abstract: Calculates the absolute center of the bounding box.

Structs/Polygon.html#/centroid.name: centroid
Structs/Polygon.html#/centroid.abstract: Calculates the centroid using the mean of all vertices.

Structs/Polygon.html#/centerOfMass.name: centerOfMass
Structs/Polygon.html#/centerOfMass.abstract: Calculates the center of mass using the centroid of polygon formula.

Structs/Point.html#/coordinates.name: coordinates
Structs/Point.html#/coordinates.abstract: The position at which the point is located.

Structs/Point.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Structs/Point.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a point defined by the given position.

Structs/MultiPolygon.html#/coordinates.name: coordinates
Structs/MultiPolygon.html#/coordinates.abstract: The positions at which the multipolygon is located. Each nested array corresponds to one polygon.

Structs/MultiPolygon.html#/polygons.name: polygons
Structs/MultiPolygon.html#/polygons.abstract: The polygon geometries that conceptually form the multipolygon.

Structs/MultiPolygon.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Structs/MultiPolygon.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a multipolygon defined by the given positions.

Structs/MultiPolygon.html#/contains(_:ig.name: contains(_:ignoreBoundary:)
Structs/MultiPolygon.html#/contains(_:ig.abstract: Determines if the given coordinate falls within any of the polygons.

Structs/MultiPoint.html#/coordinates.name: coordinates
Structs/MultiPoint.html#/coordinates.abstract: The positions at which the multipoint is located.

Structs/MultiPoint.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Structs/MultiPoint.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a multipoint defined by the given positions.

Structs/MultiLineString.html#/coordinate.name: coordinates
Structs/MultiLineString.html#/coordinate.abstract: The positions at which the multi–line string is located. Each nested array corresponds to one line string.

Structs/MultiLineString.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Structs/MultiLineString.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a multi–line string defined by the given positions.

Structs/LineString/IndexedCoordinate.htm.name: distance
Structs/LineString/IndexedCoordinate.htm.abstract: The coordinate’s distance from the start of the polyline

Structs/LineString.html#/coordinates.name: coordinates
Structs/LineString.html#/coordinates.abstract: The positions at which the line string is located.

Structs/LineString.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Structs/LineString.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a line string defined by given positions.

Structs/LineString.html#/bezier(resoluti.name: bezier(resolution:sharpness:)
Structs/LineString.html#/bezier(resoluti.abstract: Returns the line string transformed into an approximation of a curve by applying a Bézier spline algorithm.

Structs/LineString.html#/trimmed(from:to.name: trimmed(from:to:)
Structs/LineString.html#/trimmed(from:to.abstract: Returns the portion of the line string that begins at the given start distance and extends the given stop distance along the line string.

Structs/LineString.html#/trimmed(from:di.name: trimmed(from:distance:)
Structs/LineString.html#/trimmed(from:di.abstract: Returns the portion of the line string that begins at the given coordinate and extends the given distance along the line string.

Structs/LineString/IndexedCoordinate.htm.name: IndexedCoordinate
Structs/LineString/IndexedCoordinate.htm.abstract: IndexedCoordinate is a coordinate with additional information such as the index from its position in the polyline and distance from the start of the polyline.

Structs/LineString.html#/coordinateFromS.name: coordinateFromStart(distance:)
Structs/LineString.html#/coordinateFromS.abstract: Returns a coordinate along a line string at a certain distance from the start of the polyline.

Structs/LineString.html#/indexedCoordina.name: indexedCoordinateFromStart(distance:)
Structs/LineString.html#/indexedCoordina.abstract: Returns an indexed coordinate along a line string at a certain distance from the start of the polyline.

Structs/LineString.html#/distance(from:t.name: distance(from:to:)
Structs/LineString.html#/distance(from:t.abstract: Returns the distance along a slice of the line string with the given endpoints.

Structs/LineString.html#/sliced(from:to:.name: sliced(from:to:)
Structs/LineString.html#/sliced(from:to:.abstract: Returns a subset of the line string between two given coordinates.

Structs/LineString.html#/closestCoordina.name: closestCoordinate(to:)
Structs/LineString.html#/closestCoordina.abstract: Returns the geographic coordinate along the line string that is closest to the given coordinate as the crow flies.

Structs/LineString.html#/simplified(tole.name: simplified(tolerance:highestQuality:)
Structs/LineString.html#/simplified(tole.abstract: Returns a copy of the line string simplified using the Ramer–Douglas–Peucker algorithm.

Structs/LineString.html#/simplify(tolera.name: simplify(tolerance:highestQuality:)
Structs/LineString.html#/simplify(tolera.abstract: Simplifies the line string in place using the Ramer–Douglas–Peucker algorithm.

Structs/GeometryCollection.html#/geometr.name: geometries
Structs/GeometryCollection.html#/geometr.abstract: The geometries contained by the geometry collection.

Structs/GeometryCollection.html#/init(ge.name: init(geometries:)
Structs/GeometryCollection.html#/init(ge.abstract: Initializes a geometry collection defined by the given geometries.

Structs/GeometryCollection.html#/init(_:.name: init(_:)
Structs/GeometryCollection.html#/init(_:.abstract: Initializes a geometry collection coincident to the given multipolygon.

Structs/FeatureCollection.html#/init(fea.name: init(features:)
Structs/FeatureCollection.html#/init(fea.abstract: Initializes a feature collection containing the given features.

Structs/Feature.html#/identifier.name: identifier
Structs/Feature.html#/identifier.abstract: A string or number that commonly identifies the feature in the context of a data set.

Structs/Feature.html#/properties.name: properties
Structs/Feature.html#/properties.abstract: Arbitrary, JSON-compatible attributes to associate with the feature.

Structs/Feature.html#/geometry.name: geometry
Structs/Feature.html#/geometry.abstract: The geometry at which the feature is located.

Structs/Feature.html#/init(geometry:).name: init(geometry:)
Structs/Feature.html#/init(geometry:).abstract: Initializes a feature located at the given geometry.

Structs/BoundingBox.html#/southWest.name: southWest
Structs/BoundingBox.html#/southWest.abstract: The southwesternmost position contained in the bounding box.

Structs/BoundingBox.html#/northEast.name: northEast
Structs/BoundingBox.html#/northEast.abstract: The northeasternmost position contained in the bounding box.

Structs/BoundingBox.html#/init(from:).name: init(from:)
Structs/BoundingBox.html#/init(from:).abstract: Initializes the smallest bounding box that contains all the given coordinates.

Structs/BoundingBox.html#/init(southWest.name: init(southWest:northEast:)
Structs/BoundingBox.html#/init(southWest.abstract: Initializes a bounding box defined by its southwesternmost and northeasternmost positions.

Structs/BoundingBox.html#/contains(_:ign.name: contains(_:ignoreBoundary:)
Structs/BoundingBox.html#/contains(_:ign.abstract: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the bounding box contains the given position.

Structs/BoundingBox.html.name: BoundingBox
Structs/BoundingBox.html.abstract: A bounding box indicates the extremes of a GeoJSONObject along the x- and y-axes (longitude and latitude, respectively).

Structs/Feature.html.name: Feature
Structs/Feature.html.abstract: A Feature object represents a spatially bounded thing.

Structs/FeatureCollection.html.name: FeatureCollection
Structs/FeatureCollection.html.abstract: A FeatureCollection object is a collection of Feature objects.

Structs/GeometryCollection.html.name: GeometryCollection
Structs/GeometryCollection.html.abstract: A GeometryCollection geometry is a heterogeneous collection of Geometry objects that are related.

Structs/LineString.html.name: LineString
Structs/LineString.html.abstract: A LineString geometry is a collection of two or more positions, each position connected to the next position linearly.

Structs/MultiLineString.html.name: MultiLineString
Structs/MultiLineString.html.abstract: A MultiLineString geometry is a collection of LineString geometries that are disconnected but related.

Structs/MultiPoint.html.name: MultiPoint
Structs/MultiPoint.html.abstract: A MultiPoint geometry represents a collection of disconnected but related positions.

Structs/MultiPolygon.html.name: MultiPolygon
Structs/MultiPolygon.html.abstract: A MultiPolygon geometry is a collection of Polygon geometries that are disconnected but related.

Structs/Polygon.html.name: Polygon
Structs/Polygon.html.abstract: A Polygon geometry is conceptually a collection of Rings that form a single connected geometry.

Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html.name: RadianCoordinate2D
Structs/RadianCoordinate2D.html.abstract: A coordinate pair measured in radians, as opposed to LocationCoordinate2D, which is measured in degrees of arc.

Structs/Ring.html.name: Ring
Structs/Ring.html.abstract: A linear ring is a closed figure bounded by three or more straight line segments.

Protocols/GeoJSONObjectConvertible.html.name: GeoJSONObjectConvertible
Protocols/GeoJSONObjectConvertible.html.abstract: A type that can be represented as a GeoJSONObject instance.

Protocols/ForeignMemberContainer.html.name: ForeignMemberContainer
Protocols/ForeignMemberContainer.html.abstract: A GeoJSON object that can contain foreign members in arbitrary keys.

Protocols/GeometryConvertible.html.name: GeometryConvertible
Protocols/GeometryConvertible.html.abstract: A type that can be represented as a Geometry instance.

Functions.html#/intersection(_:_:).name: intersection(_:_:)
Functions.html#/intersection(_:_:).abstract: Returns the intersection of two line segments.

Functions.html#/mid(_:_:).name: mid(_:_:)
Functions.html#/mid(_:_:).abstract: Returns the point midway between two coordinates measured in degrees.

Extensions/CodingUserInfoKey.html#/inclu.name: includesForeignMembers
Extensions/CodingUserInfoKey.html#/inclu.abstract: Indicates if coding of foreign members is enabled.

Extensions/LocationCoordinate2D.html#/di.name: direction(to:)
Extensions/LocationCoordinate2D.html#/di.abstract: Returns the direction from the receiver to the given coordinate.

Extensions/LocationCoordinate2D.html#/co.name: coordinate(at:facing:)
Extensions/LocationCoordinate2D.html#/co.abstract: Returns a coordinate a certain Haversine distance away in the given direction.

Extensions/LocationCoordinate2D.html#/di.name: distance(to:)
Extensions/LocationCoordinate2D.html#/di.abstract: Returns the Haversine distance between two coordinates measured in degrees.

Extensions/LocationDirection.html#/wrap(.name: wrap(min:max:)
Extensions/LocationDirection.html#/wrap(.abstract: Returns a normalized number given min and max bounds.

Extensions/LocationDirection.html#/diffe.name: difference(from:)
Extensions/LocationDirection.html#/diffe.abstract: Returns the smaller difference between the receiver and another direction.

Extensions/CodingUserInfoKey.html.name: CodingUserInfoKey
Extensions/CodingUserInfoKey.html.abstract: Key to pass to populate a userInfo dictionary, which is passed to the JSONDecoder or JSONEncoder to enable processing foreign members.

Enums/JSONValue.html#/array(_:).name: array(_:)
Enums/JSONValue.html#/array(_:).abstract: A heterogeneous array of JSON values and null values.

Enums/JSONValue.html#/object(_:).name: object(_:)
Enums/JSONValue.html#/object(_:).abstract: An object containing JSON values and null values keyed by strings.

Enums/JSONValue.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Enums/JSONValue.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a JSON value representing the given string.

Enums/JSONValue.html#/rawValue.name: rawValue
Enums/JSONValue.html#/rawValue.abstract: This branch must happen after the NSNumber branch

Enums/Geometry.html#/lineString(_:).name: lineString(_:)
Enums/Geometry.html#/lineString(_:).abstract: A collection of two or more positions, each position connected to the next position linearly.

Enums/Geometry.html#/polygon(_:).name: polygon(_:)
Enums/Geometry.html#/polygon(_:).abstract: Conceptually, a collection of Rings that form a single connected geometry.

Enums/Geometry.html#/multiPoint(_:).name: multiPoint(_:)
Enums/Geometry.html#/multiPoint(_:).abstract: A collection of positions that are disconnected but related.

Enums/Geometry.html#/multiLineString(_:).name: multiLineString(_:)
Enums/Geometry.html#/multiLineString(_:).abstract: A collection of LineString geometries that are disconnected but related.

Enums/Geometry.html#/multiPolygon(_:).name: multiPolygon(_:)
Enums/Geometry.html#/multiPolygon(_:).abstract: A collection of Polygon geometries that are disconnected but related.

Enums/Geometry.html#/geometryCollection(.name: geometryCollection(_:)
Enums/Geometry.html#/geometryCollection(.abstract: A heterogeneous collection of geometries that are related.

Enums/Geometry.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Enums/Geometry.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a geometry representing the given geometry–convertible instance.

Enums/GeoJSONObject.html#/geometry(_:).name: geometry(_:)
Enums/GeoJSONObject.html#/geometry(_:).abstract: A Geometry object represents points, curves, and surfaces in coordinate space.

Enums/GeoJSONObject.html#/feature(_:).name: feature(_:)
Enums/GeoJSONObject.html#/feature(_:).abstract: A Feature object represents a spatially bounded thing.

Enums/GeoJSONObject.html#/featureCollect.name: featureCollection(_:)
Enums/GeoJSONObject.html#/featureCollect.abstract: A FeatureCollection object is a collection of Feature objects.

Enums/GeoJSONObject.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Enums/GeoJSONObject.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a GeoJSON object representing the given GeoJSON object–convertible instance.

Enums/FeatureIdentifier.html#/init(_:).name: init(_:)
Enums/FeatureIdentifier.html#/init(_:).abstract: Initializes a feature identifier representing the given string.

Enums/GeoJSONObject.html.name: GeoJSONObject
Enums/GeoJSONObject.html.abstract: A GeoJSON object represents a Geometry, Feature, or collection of Features.

Enums/Geometry.html.name: Geometry
Enums/Geometry.html.abstract: A Geometry object represents points, curves, and surfaces in coordinate space. Use an instance of this enumeration whenever a value could be any kind of Geometry object.

Enums/JSONValue.html.name: JSONValue
Enums/JSONValue.html.abstract: A JSON value represents an object, array, or fragment.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
